Day 1.Description: This workout targets your pushing muscles: chest, shoulders, and triceps. It builds upper body size and strength while finishing with focused core work.

Exercises.title: Flat Dumbbell Press
Exercises.description: Lie flat on a bench holding dumbbells at chest level. Press them upward until arms are fully extended, then lower back down slowly. This targets the chest, front deltoids, and triceps.

Exercises.title: Incline Dumbbell Press
Exercises.description: Lie on an incline bench with dumbbells above your chest. Press upward, focusing on squeezing the upper chest. Lower slowly to shoulder level.

Exercises.title: Overhead Shoulder Press
Exercises.description: Stand or sit with dumbbells at shoulder height. Press them overhead until your arms are extended, then lower under control. Targets all heads of the deltoids and triceps.

Exercises.title: Lateral Raises
Exercises.description: Hold dumbbells by your sides and raise them to shoulder height with a slight bend in your elbows. Pause, then lower slowly. Works the side delts for broader shoulders.

Exercises.title: Dumbbell Skullcrushers
Exercises.description: Lie flat with dumbbells extended above your head. Bend at the elbows to lower the weights near your forehead, then extend arms to starting position. Focuses on triceps.

Exercises.title: Bench Dips
Exercises.description: Place your hands behind you on a bench and feet extended out. Lower your body until elbows are at 90 degrees, then push back up. Great for triceps and shoulders.

Exercises.title: Plank
Exercises.description: Hold your body in a straight line from head to heels, supported by forearms and toes. Engage your core and glutes. Builds core endurance and stability.

Exercises.title: Leg Raises
Exercises.description: Lie on your back with legs extended. Lift legs to vertical and lower slowly without touching the ground. Strengthens lower abs.

Exercises.title: Russian Twists
Exercises.description: Sit with knees bent and feet lifted. Twist your torso side to side while holding a weight, touching the ground on each side. Works obliques and core.

Day 2.Description: A workout focused on pulling muscles: back and biceps. Includes a fat-burning HIIT run to increase endurance and shred fat.

Exercises.title: Bent-over Dumbbell Rows
Exercises.description: With a flat back and slight knee bend, hinge at hips and row dumbbells to your ribs. Squeeze shoulder blades together. Strengthens lats and rhomboids.

Exercises.title: Single-arm Dumbbell Row
Exercises.description: Place one knee and hand on a bench, other foot on the ground. Row dumbbell toward your waist, keeping elbow close. Focus on lats and rear delts.

Exercises.title: Reverse Flys
Exercises.description: With a flat back, lift dumbbells out to the sides in an arc. Pause at the top and lower slowly. Targets rear delts and upper back.

Exercises.title: Dumbbell Bicep Curls
Exercises.description: Stand tall holding dumbbells. Curl weights to your shoulders, keeping elbows close to your sides. Lower under control. Isolates biceps.

Exercises.title: Hammer Curls
Exercises.description: Like bicep curls but with palms facing in. Targets biceps and forearms with a more neutral grip.

Exercises.title: Cardio
Exercises.description: Outdoor cardio activity such as running, biking, or jogging for time or distance. Enhances endurance and burns fat.

Day 3.Description: Leg day to develop powerful and sculpted lower body muscles, with added core work to improve stability and posture.

Exercises.title: Goblet Squats
Exercises.description: Hold a dumbbell at your chest and squat down with your chest up and knees out. Push through heels to return up. Works quads, glutes, and core.

Exercises.title: Walking Lunges
Exercises.description: Step forward into a lunge with both knees at 90 degrees. Push off the front leg and bring the back foot forward. Builds balance and lower body strength.

Exercises.title: Romanian Deadlifts
Exercises.description: Hold dumbbells in front of thighs. Hinge at hips, keeping your back flat, lowering the weights down your legs. Stretch and contract hamstrings and glutes.

Exercises.title: Bulgarian Split Squats
Exercises.description: Stand in front of a bench and place one foot behind you. Lower into a lunge with your front knee over your ankle. Strengthens quads, glutes, and balance.

Exercises.title: Calf Raises
Exercises.description: Stand tall and lift your heels as high as possible, then lower slowly. Can be done on a step for deeper range. Works calf muscles.

Exercises.title: Cable Crunch or Weighted Sit-Up
Exercises.description: Use a rope cable or hold a weight on your chest. Crunch down from the waist, keeping tension in the abs.

Exercises.title: Plank Shoulder Taps
Exercises.description: In a high plank, tap each shoulder with the opposite hand, maintaining a stable torso. Builds anti-rotational core strength.

Exercises.title: Side Plank
Exercises.description: Lie on one side and lift your body using your forearm. Keep body in a straight line. Great for obliques and core stability.

Day 4.Description: A high-volume circuit targeting all upper body muscles, followed by a moderate-paced run to build stamina and burn calories.

Exercises.title: Push-Ups
Exercises.description: Lower your chest to the floor with elbows tucked at 45 degrees, then press back up. Works chest, shoulders, triceps, and core.

Exercises.title: Dumbbell Rows
Exercises.description: In a bent-over position, row dumbbells to your ribs with elbows close to your body. Focuses on mid-back muscles.

Exercises.title: Arnold Press
Exercises.description: Start with palms facing you at shoulder level. Rotate palms outward as you press up. Engages all heads of the delts.

Exercises.title: Lateral Raises
Exercises.description: Hold dumbbells by your sides and raise them to shoulder height with a slight bend in your elbows. Pause, then lower slowly. Works the side delts for broader shoulders.

Exercises.title: Triceps Kickbacks
Exercises.description: Bend at the waist with elbows pinned back, then extend your arms fully. Focus on squeezing triceps at the top.

Exercises.title: EZ Bar or Dumbbell Curl Dropset
Exercises.description: Start with heavier curls, then drop weight and continue until failure. Maximizes biceps fatigue and growth.

Exercises.title: Run
Exercises.description: A steady-paced jog or run used for fat loss and cardiovascular health.

Day 5.Description: A full-body strength session using compound lifts followed by high-intensity sprint intervals for conditioning and fat loss.

Exercises.title: Deadlifts
Exercises.description: With dumbbells in hand and feet shoulder-width, hinge at hips and lift while keeping your back neutral. Targets hamstrings, glutes, and back.

Exercises.title: Squat Press
Exercises.description: Hold dumbbells at shoulders, squat down, and press overhead as you stand. Combines leg and shoulder strength.

Exercises.title: Clean & Press
Exercises.description: Explosive movement lifting weights from floor to shoulders (clean) then pressing overhead. Full-body power move.

Exercises.title: Kettlebell/Dumbbell Swings
Exercises.description: Hinge at the hips to swing the weight between your legs, then explode forward with hips to shoulder level. Improves power and conditioning.

Exercises.title: Box Jumps or Step-Ups
Exercises.description: Jump or step onto a box with control, landing softly. Develops explosive power and leg strength.

Exercises.title: Farmer’s Carries
Exercises.description: Hold heavy dumbbells at your sides and walk for time or distance. Improves grip, core stability, and conditioning.

Exercises.title: Sprints
Exercises.description: Short bursts of max-effort running followed by rest. Improves speed and burns body fat.

Day 6.Description: A deep core workout to carve definition paired with a long steady-state run to enhance endurance and promote fat burn.

Exercises.title: V-Ups
Exercises.description: Lie flat and lift your arms and legs simultaneously to meet above your core. Excellent for full-ab engagement.

Exercises.title: Russian Twists
Exercises.description: Sit with knees bent and feet lifted. Twist your torso side to side while holding a weight, touching the ground on each side. Works obliques and core.

Exercises.title: Plank
Exercises.description: Hold your body in a straight line from head to heels, supported by forearms and toes. Engage your core and glutes. Builds core endurance and stability.

Exercises.title: Cable or Dumbbell Side Bends
Exercises.description: Hold a weight in one hand and bend sideways at the waist. Return to standing. Strengthens the obliques.

Exercises.title: Run
Exercises.description: A steady-paced jog or run used for fat loss and cardiovascular health.

Day 7.Description: Low-intensity activity like walking, stretching, or yoga to promote muscle recovery, mobility, and blood flow without taxing your system.

Exercises.title: Active Recovery
Exercises.description: Low-intensity movement such as walking, stretching, or yoga to promote recovery and reduce soreness.

Exercises.title: Bulgarian Split Squats
Exercises.description: Stand in front of a bench and place one foot behind you. Lower into a lunge with your front knee over your ankle. Strengthens quads, glutes, and balance.

Exercises.title: Calf Raises
Exercises.description: Stand tall and lift your heels as high as possible, then lower slowly. Can be done on a step for deeper range. Works calf muscles.

Exercises.title: Cable Crunch or Weighted Sit-Up
Exercises.description: Use a rope cable or hold a weight on your chest. Crunch down from the waist, keeping tension in the abs.

Exercises.title: Plank Shoulder Taps
Exercises.description: In a high plank, tap each shoulder with the opposite hand, maintaining a stable torso. Builds anti-rotational core strength.

Exercises.title: Side Plank
Exercises.description: Lie on one side and lift your body using your forearm. Keep body in a straight line. Great for obliques and core stability.

Day 6.Description: A deep core workout to carve definition paired with a long steady-state run to enhance endurance and promote fat burn.

Exercises.title: V-Ups
Exercises.description: Lie flat and lift your arms and legs simultaneously to meet above your core. Excellent for full-ab engagement.

Exercises.title: Russian Twists
Exercises.description: Sit with knees bent and feet lifted. Twist your torso side to side while holding a weight, touching the ground on each side. Works obliques and core.

Exercises.title: Plank
Exercises.description: Hold your body in a straight line from head to heels, supported by forearms and toes. Engage your core and glutes. Builds core endurance and stability.

Exercises.title: Cable or Dumbbell Side Bends
Exercises.description: Hold a weight in one hand and bend sideways at the waist. Return to standing. Strengthens the obliques.

Exercises.title: Run
Exercises.description: A steady-paced jog or run used for fat loss and cardiovascular health.

Day 7.Description: Low-intensity activity like walking, stretching, or yoga to promote muscle recovery, mobility, and blood flow without taxing your system.

Exercises.title: Active Recovery
Exercises.description: Low-intensity movement such as walking, stretching, or yoga to promote recovery and reduce soreness.

Day 1.Description: This workout targets your pushing muscles: chest, shoulders, and triceps. It builds upper body size and strength while finishing with focused core work.

Exercises.title: Flat Dumbbell Press
Exercises.description: Lie flat on a bench holding dumbbells at chest level. Press them upward until arms are fully extended, then lower back down slowly. This targets the chest, front deltoids, and triceps.

Exercises.title: Incline Dumbbell Press
Exercises.description: Lie on an incline bench with dumbbells above your chest. Press upward, focusing on squeezing the upper chest. Lower slowly to shoulder level.

Exercises.title: Overhead Shoulder Press
Exercises.description: Stand or sit with dumbbells at shoulder height. Press them overhead until your arms are extended, then lower under control. Targets all heads of the deltoids and triceps.

Exercises.title: Lateral Raises
Exercises.description: Hold dumbbells by your sides and raise them to shoulder height with a slight bend in your elbows. Pause, then lower slowly. Works the side delts for broader shoulders.

Exercises.title: Dumbbell Skullcrushers
Exercises.description: Lie flat with dumbbells extended above your head. Bend at the elbows to lower the weights near your forehead, then extend arms to starting position. Focuses on triceps.

Exercises.title: Bench Dips
Exercises.description: Place your hands behind you on a bench and feet extended out. Lower your body until elbows are at 90 degrees, then push back up. Great for triceps and shoulders.

Exercises.title: Plank
Exercises.description: Hold your body in a straight line from head to heels, supported by forearms and toes. Engage your core and glutes. Builds core endurance and stability.

Exercises.title: Leg Raises
Exercises.description: Lie on your back with legs extended. Lift legs to vertical and lower slowly without touching the ground. Strengthens lower abs.

Exercises.title: Russian Twists
Exercises.description: Sit with knees bent and feet lifted. Twist your torso side to side while holding a weight, touching the ground on each side. Works obliques and core.

Day 2.Description: A workout focused on pulling muscles: back and biceps. Includes a fat-burning HIIT run to increase endurance and shred fat.

Exercises.title: Bent-over Dumbbell Rows
Exercises.description: With a flat back and slight knee bend, hinge at hips and row dumbbells to your ribs. Squeeze shoulder blades together. Strengthens lats and rhomboids.

Exercises.title: Single-arm Dumbbell Row
Exercises.description: Place one knee and hand on a bench, other foot on the ground. Row dumbbell toward your waist, keeping elbow close. Focus on lats and rear delts.

Exercises.title: Reverse Flys
Exercises.description: With a flat back, lift dumbbells out to the sides in an arc. Pause at the top and lower slowly. Targets rear delts and upper back.

Exercises.title: Dumbbell Bicep Curls
Exercises.description: Stand tall holding dumbbells. Curl weights to your shoulders, keeping elbows close to your sides. Lower under control. Isolates biceps.

Exercises.title: Hammer Curls
Exercises.description: Like bicep curls but with palms facing in. Targets biceps and forearms with a more neutral grip.

Exercises.title: Cardio
Exercises.description: Outdoor cardio activity such as running, biking, or jogging for time or distance. Enhances endurance and burns fat.

Day 3.Description: Leg day to develop powerful and sculpted lower body muscles, with added core work to improve stability and posture.

Exercises.title: Goblet Squats
Exercises.description: Hold a dumbbell at your chest and squat down with your chest up and knees out. Push through heels to return up. Works quads, glutes, and core.

Exercises.title: Walking Lunges
Exercises.description: Step forward into a lunge with both knees at 90 degrees. Push off the front leg and bring the back foot forward. Builds balance and lower body strength.

Exercises.title: Romanian Deadlifts
Exercises.description: Hold dumbbells in front of thighs. Hinge at hips, keeping your back flat, lowering the weights down your legs. Stretch and contract hamstrings and glutes.

Exercises.title: Bulgarian Split Squats
Exercises.description: Stand in front of a bench and place one foot behind you. Lower into a lunge with your front knee over your ankle. Strengthens quads, glutes, and balance.

Exercises.title: Calf Raises
Exercises.description: Stand tall and lift your heels as high as possible, then lower slowly. Can be done on a step for deeper range. Works calf muscles.

Exercises.title: Cable Crunch or Weighted Sit-Up
Exercises.description: Use a rope cable or hold a weight on your chest. Crunch down from the waist, keeping tension in the abs.

Exercises.title: Plank Shoulder Taps
Exercises.description: In a high plank, tap each shoulder with the opposite hand, maintaining a stable torso. Builds anti-rotational core strength.

Exercises.title: Side Plank
Exercises.description: Lie on one side and lift your body using your forearm. Keep body in a straight line. Great for obliques and core stability.

Day 4.Description: A high-volume circuit targeting all upper body muscles, followed by a moderate-paced run to build stamina and burn calories.

Exercises.title: Push-Ups
Exercises.description: Lower your chest to the floor with elbows tucked at 45 degrees, then press back up. Works chest, shoulders, triceps, and core.

Exercises.title: Dumbbell Rows
Exercises.description: In a bent-over position, row dumbbells to your ribs with elbows close to your body. Focuses on mid-back muscles.

Exercises.title: Arnold Press
Exercises.description: Start with palms facing you at shoulder level. Rotate palms outward as you press up. Engages all heads of the delts.

Exercises.title: Lateral Raises
Exercises.description: Hold dumbbells by your sides and raise them to shoulder height with a slight bend in your elbows. Pause, then lower slowly. Works the side delts for broader shoulders.

Exercises.title: Triceps Kickbacks
Exercises.description: Bend at the waist with elbows pinned back, then extend your arms fully. Focus on squeezing triceps at the top.

Exercises.title: EZ Bar or Dumbbell Curl Dropset
Exercises.description: Start with heavier curls, then drop weight and continue until failure. Maximizes biceps fatigue and growth.

Exercises.title: Run
Exercises.description: A steady-paced jog or run used for fat loss and cardiovascular health.

Day 5.Description: A full-body strength session using compound lifts followed by high-intensity sprint intervals for conditioning and fat loss.

Exercises.title: Deadlifts
Exercises.description: With dumbbells in hand and feet shoulder-width, hinge at hips and lift while keeping your back neutral. Targets hamstrings, glutes, and back.

Exercises.title: Squat Press
Exercises.description: Hold dumbbells at shoulders, squat down, and press overhead as you stand. Combines leg and shoulder strength.

Exercises.description: Explosive movement lifting weights from floor to shoulders (clean) then pressing overhead. Full-body power move.

Exercises.title: Kettlebell/Dumbbell Swings
Exercises.description: Hinge at the hips to swing the weight between your legs, then explode forward with hips to shoulder level. Improves power and conditioning.

Exercises.title: Box Jumps or Step-Ups
Exercises.description: Jump or step onto a box with control, landing softly. Develops explosive power and leg strength.

Exercises.title: Farmer’s Carries
Exercises.description: Hold heavy dumbbells at your sides and walk for time or distance. Improves grip, core stability, and conditioning.

Exercises.title: Sprints
Exercises.description: Short bursts of max-effort running followed by rest. Improves speed and burns body fat.
